data.title: Style fixes.
data.body: Not much to see.

data.title: Removed the RA mod DLL dependency from TD
data.body: One step further towards https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7526.

data.title: Map suddently becomes completely unrevealed for one player
data.body:
About 25 minutes into one game (about 83/84% in the replay), the map suddenly became completely unrevealed again for one player (not for the other one):
![map_midgame](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12261410/12079618/25c1aa44-b240-11e5-99c3-619c3b7057f8.png)
![map_lategame](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12261410/12079619/27129cfa-b240-11e5-91ba-dcb0d9fd90a9.png)

The white patch in the upper left corner is due to https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10396
This is the replay of the game: [OpenRA-2016-01-03T153137Z.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/76654/OpenRA-2016-01-03T153137Z.zip)

data.title: Add the "gen2" map importer.
data.body:
Expands #10368 with integration of the low level components and a collection of style fixes.
Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9335.

data.title: ground unit (paratrooper?) stuck outside of the map
data.body:
I happened to get a unit outside of the map (upper left corner). I assume it was a paratrooper, but I am not sure. I could not do anything with this unit, neither could the enemy kill it. But it added visibility to the corresponding corner:
![out-of-map unit](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12261410/12079569/3cdc7ae4-b23e-11e5-86e5-4ad40db1e545.png)
This is the replay of the game: [OpenRA-2016-01-03T153137Z.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/76654/OpenRA-2016-01-03T153137Z.zip)

data.title: Global chat can crash the game when the player is ingame
data.body:
I started a singleplayer game, which crashed immediately upon start with an NRE [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/ScrollPanelWidget.cs#L382). `makeWidget` was null, presumably because there is no UI for the global chat ingame.
The calling method was [this](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/ScrollPanelWidget.cs#L377).
`item` was `[13:05:06] *** SharpTeeth has quit IRC`.

data.title: Facebook and Twitter buttons on the lobby-window
data.body:
Adding two small Facebook and Twitter buttons on the global lobby window could be useful (to promote our project on social networks). 

These buttons could open the user's browser and display a pre-written message like:
## 

I've started an #OpenRA #game (www.openra.net). Just waiting for more #gamers. #commandandconquer #redalert #gaming #multiplayer
## 

character count for this message : 128

Mock-up:
http://img15.hostingpics.net/pics/275618ScreenShot002.png

data.title: Polished the Dune 2000 low power graphics
data.body:
~~The dish not spinning should be enough.~~ Our disabled overlay clashes with other overlays.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/12077976/04df0318-b1fe-11e5-9152-9f1446170013.png)

I also fixed the Starport lights not showing up at all. Probably a regression from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10119.
Made them not blink when on low power. It is a bit unlogical that the starport is powered down and non-operational, but the lights are still there. Our `WithProductionOverlay` was missing that switch.

data.title: Fixed AI bots not building any Carryalls
data.body: This makes them perform bad in the late game economy.

data.title: New interface for resource display information
data.body:
This is part of the resource refactor.

Currently, the chrome bits pull there information directly from the `PlayerResources` trait. This will function poorly once we have multiple `PlayerResources` traits. In order to make sure that they will continue to work, I've created a new interface, `IResourceDisplay`, indicating that a trait provides display information about a resource. I've also created a trait `ResourceDisplay` which implements the interface provides all of the current UI logic for resources.

This will make it easier for mods to customize their resource displays while reusing the existing chrome bits, and reduce the coupling of the UI code on the structure of resources.

data.title: Spectator only beacons
data.body:
Would be nice for specs to be able to point things out to eachother. Would work well with the upcoming spec only chat feature.

data.title: Speed up AutoTarget.ChooseTarget among groups of allied units.
data.body:
Most auto target scans will be conducted among groups of allied units unable to target each other because they are allied and their weapons only target enemies. Since they cannot target each other, the scan will be repeated constantly. Realising this, we can significantly reduce the performance impact of auto target scanning by bailing early in this scenario to avoid carrying out expensive targeting checks on friendly units which we know will fail anyway.

On the RA shellmap, this reduces total CPU usage of `ChooseTarget` from 2.47% to 1.54%. I watched a replay from release-20151224 earlier that had large standing armies for a fair bit that clocked in at like 10%. That will probably get significantly reduced too.

data.title: D2k map importer has wrong actor names for Deviator and Devastator
data.body: Those were apparently forgotten during the recent mod overhaul.

data.title: Fix upgrade rule output spam
data.body: Fix a big derp from #10252.

data.title: Finish D2K worm implementation
data.body:
This implements the sand trail and lightning as in the original game, so we can now finally mark this beast of a feature as finished :tada:

Also adds upgrade support to `WithActiveAnimation` (now renamed to `WithIdleAnimation` for consistency with `WithIdleOverlay`) and `LeavesTrails`, and tidies up the worm attacking code.

Depends on #10380.

Closes #7289.
Closes #7290.

data.title: Fix duplicated end of file newline being saved to upgraded yaml.
data.body: This cuts down the upgrade diff noise.

data.title: Made attackable positions customizable
data.body:
This allows modders to define custom offsets relative to `Actor.CenterPosition` that will be targeted instead of `CenterPosition`, which is extremely useful for tall units like mechs.

~~Also adds custom HitShapes to all TS units (not buildings for now, no point in that until we have footprint/custom shape support).~~ split to #11169.

Closes #7717.

data.title: Arbitrary zoom / custom resolution support
data.body:
This outlines my plan for fixing our issues relating to zoom, custom resolutions, and HiDPI support in one fell swoop.  I've referred to it several times in the past, so I figure it is time to document this properly.  From my perspective this supersedes all the previous tickets, but of course others are free to argue against this.

**User interface**

Two new dropdowns are included in the display settings: UI resolution and World resolution (like UT3 and i'm sure other games have done).  They contain values for "Native", a selection of popular defaults with a fixed width and a height calculated from the aspect ratio, and a "custom" option that exposes text fields for entering a manual width.  These set the (fixed) size of the UI, and the default size/zoom of the world.

Players can use ctrl + scroll to arbitrarily zoom the world (but not the UI) between the minimum and maximum limits (explained below).  The `.` key (currently used for pixel doubling) is used to reset the world to the default zoom configured in the settings.

**Implementation**

The world rendering (everything that scales with the world, so this excludes selection decorations, target lines, etc) is rendered into a framebuffer that is configured a viewport size calculated from the zoom and default resolution, and the result is rendered using a quad covering the window viewport.  The UI rendering (everything else from the world, and then the widgets) is similarly rendered first into a framebuffer (maybe the same as the first, depending on the cost of reconfiguring a buffer vs switching to a new one), and then scaled to fill the screen.

The default "Native" value is calculated by the window / display size divided by the native pixel scale (queried from SDL).  The pixel scale will be 2 for retina displays under OSX, or between 0.75 and 2 (I think?) for the different DPI options under Windows.  We can calculate the pixel scale by comparing the resolution that we asked for with the output from [SDL_GetRendererOutputSize](https://wiki.libsdl.org/SDL_GetRendererOutputSize).  The minimum supported resolution is defined in mod.yaml (with defaults for our mods of 1024 x 700), and the maximum values are queried from the GPU (the smaller of `GL_MAX_RENDERBUFFER_SIZE` / `GL_MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE`).

To enable HiDPI rendering we need to set `SDL_WINDOW_ALLOW_HIGHDPI` when [creating the window](https://wiki.libsdl.org/SDL_CreateWindow), and under OSX we also need to set `NSHighResolutionCapable` in Info.plist.  I have no idea how DPI scaling works across the various linux WMs or whether they are supported by SDL.

The world is always rendered with a "zoom" of 1 into the framebuffer, so all of the fiddly code using Viewport.Zoom can be removed (yay!).  The shader-level hack for rendering the depth buffer can also be removed in favour of rendering the depth texture from the framebuffer.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29533233-arbitrary-zoom-custom-resolution-support?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Enhance CreateEffectWarhead
data.body:
This adds some randomness to the audio and visual effects of `CreateEffectWarhead` as requested by @DoGyAUT.

Also closes #10629.

data.title: Polish and improved customization for actor trails
data.body: Improves the APC and Hover MRLS in TS, and prepares the code for worm trails in D2K.

data.title: Add additional admin options to players in the lobby
data.body:
Suggested at www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=19306.

We can replace the current kick button with a dropdown with additional options:
- Transfer admin: This would allow an admin to pass control over to another specific player without having to do the quit-rejoin dance that is currently required.
- Move to spectator: This is a less harsh alternative to kicking an idle player, and is a problem that comes up fairly often in streamed games.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29530164-add-additional-admin-options-to-players-in-the-lobby?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Added TS map Tiberium Garden Redux
data.body:
Another test for https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10368. This is a map that doesn't highlight the deficiencies of our TS mod (missing bridges) and should be already playable.

Source: http://ra2maps.zzattack.org/Tiberian%20Sun/index.php?dir=Official%20Multiplayer%2FTiberium%20Garden%20Redux

Description inspired by http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Tiberium_Garden_Redux.

data.title: Speed up Aircraft.Repulse.
data.body: Avoid LINQ in the repulsion force calculation, and cache a trait lookup used when determining movement speed.

data.title: Use UTF8 instead of system locale code page
data.body:
as recommended by https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd317756

Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10332 in a cleaner way.
Probably fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10308.

data.title: Return a Target.FrozenActor in Actor.ResolveFrozenActorOrder
data.body:
...instead of a Target.Actor, which would make code dealing with the order work with false assumptions.

Fixes #10361.

Here's a list of things that need fixing before this can be merged:
- [ ] `ExternalCaptures` + `ExternalCaptureActivity`.
- [ ] `MoveAdjacentTo`.
- [ ] `Attack*` (non-turreted).
- [ ] `Enter` and friends.

...
